data.title: How to Develop a 1D Generative Adversarial Network From Scratch in Keras
data.description: Generative Adversarial Networks, or GANs for short, are a deep learning architecture for training powerful generator models. A generator model is capable of generating new artificial samples that plausibly could have come from an existing distribution of samples. GANs are comprised of both generator and discriminator models. The generator is responsible for generating new samples […]

data.title: How to Implement GAN Hacks in Keras to Train Stable Models
data.description: Generative Adversarial Networks, or GANs, are challenging to train. This is because the architecture involves both a generator and a discriminator model that compete in a zero-sum game. It means that improvements to one model come at the cost of a degrading of performance in the other model. The result is a very unstable training […]

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
data.description: Generative Adversarial Networks, or GANs for short, are an approach to generative modeling using deep learning methods, such as convolutional neural networks. data.title: 18 Impressive Applications of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
data.description: A Generative Adversarial Network, or GAN, is a type of neural network architecture for generative modeling. Generative modeling involves using a model to generate new examples that plausibly come from an existing distribution of samples, such as generating new photographs that are similar but specifically different from a dataset of existing photographs. data.title: Best Resources for Getting Started With GANs
data.description: Generative Adversarial Networks, or GANs, are a type of deep learning technique for generative modeling. GANs are the techniques behind the startlingly photorealistic generation of human faces, as well as impressive image translation tasks such as photo colorization, face de-aging, super-resolution, and more. data.title: One-Shot Learning for Face Recognition
data.description: One-shot learning is a classification task where one, or a few, examples are used to classify many new examples in the future. This characterizes tasks seen in the field of face recognition, such as face identification and face verification, where people must be classified correctly with different facial expressions, lighting conditions, accessories, and hairstyles given […]

data.title: How to Develop a Face Recognition System Using FaceNet in Keras
data.description: Face recognition is a computer vision task of identifying and verifying a person based on a photograph of their face. FaceNet is a face recognition system developed in 2015 by researchers at Google that achieved then state-of-the-art results on a range of face recognition benchmark datasets. The FaceNet system can be used broadly thanks to […]

data.title: How to Perform Face Recognition With VGGFace2 in Keras

data.title: How to Perform Face Detection with Deep Learning
data.description: Face detection is a computer vision problem that involves finding faces in photos. It is a trivial problem for humans to solve and has been solved reasonably well by classical feature-based techniques, such as the cascade classifier. More recently deep learning methods have achieved state-of-the-art results on standard benchmark face detection datasets. One example is […]

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Deep Learning for Face Recognition
data.description: Face recognition is the problem of identifying and verifying people in a photograph by their face. It is a task that is trivially performed by humans, even under varying light and when faces are changed by age or obstructed with accessories and facial hair. Nevertheless, it is remained a challenging computer vision problem for decades […]

data.title: How to Train an Object Detection Model with Keras

data.description: Deep convolutional neural network models may take days or even weeks to train on very large datasets. data.title: A Gentle Introduction to the ImageNet Challenge (ILSVRC)
data.description: The rise in popularity and use of deep learning neural network techniques can be traced back to the innovations in the application of convolutional neural networks to image classification tasks.
